page.title: 19A LANGUAGE SURVEY BLACKBURN
page.content: This was a study of the language pattern of the occupants of one street -Bastwell Rd.Our children wanted to find out which language was usually spoken at home,and which other ones were spoken,written or understood. We found that the Asian families knew several languages.Many of the women knew only a little English, one had to be spoken to in Punjabi.Another lady was born in India, but had also lived in Pakistan & Sudan. She could speak Urdu, Punjabi, Farsi, Arabic & English. All the Asian men we interviewed spoke fluent English. One man from Bangladesh speaks Bengali, Urdu, Hindi, Arabic, Nagri and English.He also understands Welsh because he has worked in Swansea.
